content.description: This is the the Cats Meow!  Using a triangular block 5' up, climb into a pod to gain the Splitter Finger Crack.  Battle through rattly fingers (crux) until the crack widens to tight hands and slippery feet.  Pumpy and sustained.
content.location: From the top of the cliff, (you may want to brush up some foot holds first):  Hike to the cell phone tower on Cat Mt. Simply look south from the cell phone tower, you will see another ledge with a viewing area (you may be able to see the crack from here)(Photo Available cdn2.apstatic.com/photos/cl…). Continue on the trail to get to this other "cliff top viewing area".  You don't have to venture  very close to the edge before you realize that you are standing on the fantastic crack.  Catatonic splits the cliff top as if struck by lightning!  Build an anchor in the crack and rap in.  #3 BD is helpful for the anchor, however you do not need it for the climb.

content.description: This cliff is directly below the summit of Cat Mountain and is home to what has been called the "Supercrack of the Adirondacks." There also many other good-looking cracks here. Most can be top-roped.
